result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Terrell II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark J Terrell in court, in custody by jail video.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant read lengthy motion for huber and good time reinstatement. DA Kohlwey stated nothing had changed since last time. Court addressed defendant, denied motion.
Bail/bond hearing on August 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
for good time/huber filed by defendant

Defendant Mark J Terrell in court, in custody without an attorney.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addressed defendant's motion for good time and Huber. Defendant made statement. Court denied defendant's motion.
Motion hearing on August 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
